title: PROTECT THIS AT ALL COST
text:
Title says it all but I‚Äôll add that not everyone wants to cross pollinate with X Corp if they‚Äôre more Meta & vice versa so no bias but I‚Äôm all for new versions of apps of the same style, we seen it happen before with MySpace to
Facebook to Instagram etc etc so the future is more going to be about what flavor and company you prefer not necessarily what‚Äôs ‚Äúbetter ‚Äú I‚Äôm here for Threads all day to succeed bc I prefer instagram predominantly and my prayers have been answered for them to roll out this style of app/ social media platform, I love it, can‚Äôt wait to see how it improves.

title: I don‚Äôt want it to change!
text: Threads is the most ‚Äúsocial‚Äù social media has felt in a while. There‚Äôs no fluff, just pure, unadulterated vibes! The simplicity and straightforwardness is the most exciting thing about this app. I dread the day ads and DMs are implemented, and pray that they won‚Äôt be. But a few things that should be implemented: an edit function, the ability to pin posts, the ability to switch between a public feed and a feed limited to the people you follow.

title: I hope to see this app available desktop Mac
text: Seems to be working OK and I‚Äôm finding a few with my friends and I hope to make more. I would like to be able to have more functions like making the page larger on my iPad, and instantly having my totals add up instead of having to refresh the page, like close it out and open it up again, and refresh it that way, but these are early days I‚Äôm sure all these will be worked on in the future. As long as it destroys Twitter, I‚Äôm OK with that.

title: I can only see the main threads, all the ones connected to it are not available
text: I really love this app, just beautiful and I'd say perfect if only it had the tags (which I'm sure you'll add), I have to report a serious problem that has recently arisen and that hasn't been resolved by reinstalling the app, I can only see the main threads, all the ones connected to it are not available, it says error, also in my profile it says an error occurred. I hope you fix it soon, great app

title: Promoting hateful content
text: I did download the app and stop using it. When I did this, I got more ads on my feed with posts from threads. Most of these posts were rage bait. Many of the posts were extremely, racist, anti lgbt, misogynistic, etc. I understand the algorithm works with what content you click on / comment on, but I thought this app would be mindful enough to not outwardly promote bigotry. As someone who is lgbt it is very disheartening to see posts on my feed from a different app with such hateful posts. I did submit a report with screenshots and hopefully they will not promote that sort of thing, especially to those in the community. Do better and I have already uninstalled the app.

title: Getting there
text:
Snappy response and easy to join. 

The algorithm needs work; I see a lot of ‚Äújunk‚Äù posts which are old, recycled screenshots from other apps (twitter and Instagram), as well as a lot of selfies and shameless pictures, which seems redundant given that Instagram exists. Hopefully after blocking and muting several accounts and ‚Äúhiding‚Äù several posts, the algorithm will adjust and serve higher quality, text-based posts with good ideas. As more thought leaders join the service I‚Äôm hoping this will also elevate my timeline to something worth my time.

title: Good app compared to twitter(X)
text: I used to use twitter or X which ever yall call it now but I could tell it was becoming more or less not as active as it used to be and the subscription service it has with slot of features that should be free, now lets look at threads, just added editing posts( Free) and polls to name a few which are FREE like they should be, I wish they would add hashtags, trending etc but I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll add it in due time so check out threads you won‚Äôt regret it!

title: Kill the bird
text: Just delete the bird. One issue. If you can‚Äôt see replies it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre not using the same login as instagram. I used an account that I never logged into in instagram. I could see threads, but no replies. Always said error try again, and it never worked. Uninstalled and reinstalled to no effect. Logged into instagram with the same account I was using in threads and replies soon (but not immediately) started appearing.

title: Without a doubt the best alternative to Twitter
text:
Threads is such an elegantly simple concept executed upon so well that it‚Äôs effectively replaced Twitter in my daily app rotation. 

Twitter still has some quality of life features that Threads is missing, but the dev team at Meta has been super transparent about changes and improvements they plan to implement which stands in stark contrast to Twitter randomly breaking the app every other day. 

Bottom line, if you‚Äôre tired of twitter, consider trying Threads out

title: Instagram badge
text: I‚Äôve used threads for a good while and honestly liked it, I liked that your Instagram account was connected with your thread acc but it had a little badge to show verification. I have a small complaint, I‚Äôve had threads since it dropped but ever since I‚Äôve never seen a ‚Äúbadge‚Äù on my account even tho I‚Äôve never deleted it + I was the 100k+ person to join. And I‚Äôm wondering is there a possibility to get it back. Honestly for my page it always looked cool to me so I was like why not have it looks dope now it doesn‚Äôt show and I haven‚Äôt seen it since

title: Fun at first‚Ä¶
text: Threads was fun for the first two weeks. After that it just became boring. It‚Äôs missing a lot of very basic features like drafts, bookmarking threads, ability to edit threads, and so much more. If they want it to be a ‚ÄúTwitter killer‚Äù they have to work a lot faster to add those things. It‚Äôs been two weeks and still nothing. Lame and boring. It only got so many people on the first day cause it is so easy to sign up for. Just use your Instagram login. Other than that, there is really nothing special about Threads. It‚Äôs just a Twitter clone but a very boring version of it.

title: Work must be done
text:
I love Threads, it‚Äôs a perfect fill in for those looking to leave X/twitter far behind.
But the moderation needs a massive overhaul for it to continue and progress.
There are porn bots that are likely even underage women or trafficked men and women, and you can block one or five but it‚Äôs like a hydra- more keep coming. And it shouldn‚Äôt take the users reporting & blocking these accounts for the company to get their moderation in order, the moderators need to be robust and quick. To stop the bots & trolls long before they infect others with their accounts.

And it‚Äôs not just the porn accounts. Moderators need to take misinformation more seriously as lives are at stake. If someone shares health or political misinformation, we have already seen the devastating impact on believers in the wrong messaging. People died, people are in jail‚Ä¶ younger generations are watching and learning. They are being targeted by bad faith actors. And moderators may not face legal action, but where is their moral compass?

Fix it.

title: Huge Glitch
text: Decided to try this app out since I‚Äôve heard others talking about it saying it‚Äôs a better Twitter. Started going through the people I follow originally on Instagram to find out that once I get off the app I‚Äôm not following them anymore. I thought it was a one time glitch until I‚Äôve tried it four times and it stills says I need to follow. Not sure when the next bug fixes will be but it‚Äôs inconvenient. The overall look is clean I can see potential in the app. Not sure if a lot of people will use this app since there is already Twitter and to have two apps that are identical is beyond me.

title: Feed
text:
Liking this app so far, many aspects of it‚Äôs current state of simplicity is enjoyable compared to many of these bloated apps today- not sure if there‚Äôs intention to keep it this way. 

One thing I don‚Äôt like so much is the feed right now. I know I don‚Äôt follow many people and they aren‚Äôt posting, but there are a lot of posts I don‚Äôt want to see, a majority of them. Maybe an interest flow or something could get this right. Not sure. But currently I don‚Äôt want to see a majority of the threads on my feed

title: Needed features + Concern
text:
The app isn‚Äôt too bad and so far it feels like old Twitter. There are problems though. You can‚Äôt save posts, no edit function, searching for people/pages isn‚Äôt easy, and no info about what‚Äôs trending. 

I‚Äôm basically saying that I want Twitter cause honestly I still do. I‚Äôm only trying this because if anything could replace Twitter it might be Thread. Mainly because it‚Äôs the closest comp and probably the literal point of the app. 

Also why are people rooting for this? I mean that would cause Meta to have an even more disproportionate influence on social media‚Ä¶

title: Threads is social interaction done right
text:
In my humble opinion, Threads allows for dialogue and different opinions to be heard and meeting more people digitally in this increasingly digital world. Like I said in my Threads bio, FB unfriended me and twiXXer canceled me and I haven‚Äôt changed my mojo or my filter. So I guess I‚Äôm meant to be here. 
Since I‚Äôm the last male descendant of the world famous Irish author James Joyce, a renown socialist, it‚Äôs only natural for me to want to vent about capitalism stifling progressive ideas and agendas. Old Money is scared of meü§£ü§£ü§£ü§£

title: Worlds better than Twitter
text: ‚Ä¶and friendlier, too! What makes threads better? It‚Äôs new, growing quickly and supporting users with a more welcoming environment that feels much more personal and far less toxic than the x‚Äôed out bird site. Loving it so far and Meta seems to really care about the user base. It‚Äôs smaller than Twitter, obviously, but in this case that‚Äôs a good thing. It feels like I can curate my feed again without seeing a bunch of overly-promoted nonsense that‚Äôs not for me.

title: It‚Äôs only beginning
text: I don't think it's right to give a review to this app at this stage, especially for those people who are saying negative things. Just a reminder, this app was developed by the former Facebook now Meta company, which is best known for connecting all of us together. I don't think they are unaware of what they are doing :) In my opinion, it's a great  'forum' for the Instagram app, which requires some updates to provide enjoyment to the audiences of this new AI century üòÖ

title: Following feed needs to be more discoverable
text:
Okay, newer versions have a following feed now. This is great, as before I‚Äôd get hundreds of posts and not one from someone I actually follow.

The problem is you‚Äôd never know it unless you hit the home button on the bottom left. I didn‚Äôt realize it was there until I was reading an article that mentioned it. The amount of screen real estate this ‚Äúsaves‚Äù seems negligible and it really feels like it‚Äôs trying to hide the follower feed.

title: Can't upload any post
text: I am extremely disappointed with the functionality of the Threads app. Despite multiple attempts, including logging out and logging back in, as well as uninstalling and reinstalling the app, I have been unable to upload new posts on my phone. It is incredibly frustrating to encounter such a basic issue that prevents me from sharing my experiences and engaging with others. In today‚Äôs fast-paced world, where seamless communication is essential, it is unacceptable for an app to fail at its core function. I sincerely hope that the developers address this problem promptly and enhance the app‚Äôs reliability and performance to ensure a smoother user experience.

title: Pretty solid
text:
Thank you Meta for creating a great alternative to Twitter. I can already feel a safer, more enjoyable space - thank you!!!

Some issues: Easy to use, but no use of hashtags. You have to log out to sign into a different account. If you wish to delete your account, it will also delete your Instagram account. 

Overall though, Threads is solid. Easy to use. Reliable and overall content is better. People are happier on Threads vs Twitter. This is the app we have been asking for!!

title: Good app but I literally cannot use it
text: Honestly I love the concept of this app and it seems like it's amazing for a lot of people but the problem is I cannot actually use it because every time I click the option to either post or reply, it immediately crashes. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling, I tried shutting my phone off, and I haven't seen any available updates to fix the problem. It's a shame because I'd love to actually engage with the platform but I can't do that if it keeps crashing like this. If there's any way to fix this that I haven't tried, please let me know üôè

title: It‚Äôs a copy of two apps
text:
The app is OK and it has a lot of bugs. It is not as good is twitter at all. I‚Äôve had so many problems since this app has came out not only that it is a copy of Twitter and a jp app that is 90% just like this app which I don‚Äôt find that is right I don‚Äôt like the fact that I have to have random feeds and stuff pop up all the time that I am not even interested in they need to have it where you can sign into more than one of your accounts. I have other accounts I would like to make one for but you can‚Äôt

It needs a lot of work, but the issue I have with it is it is just copying other apps out there and that‚Äôs not right at all

title: Threads is ok (im obsessed)
text: I like threads better than twitter because you can find your instagram friends on there and directly see everything. On twitter everyone has secret accounts and its not easy to find people in real life twitter account. I never got into twitter because of how confusing it is to find everyone and to find the right account that interests me. With threads everyone who im following on instagram is there & it makes me feel comfortable

title: Did not think Threads would be cool
text:
I joined Threads the week it launched. I didn‚Äôt think much of it. I‚Äôm Gen X and Facebook was my thing. I dabbled with Instagram and left Threads alone after my initial post. 

Fast forward and October 7 happened. I have found an amazing Jewish community on Threads. I have been building connections and my time on the other platforms has decreased. 

I like the block, hide and mute features. I‚Äôm a little confused about how to follow all the replies on individual threads, but I‚Äôm figuring it out.

title: Most toxic horrible thing Ive ever seen.
text: Instagram insists on showing me these absolutely toxic hateful posts from leftists that hate everyone not them. Theres no way to delete this bullying, toxic, openly racist, white hating, graphic sexual hate speech from my feed. Really should be illegal for instagram to force this anti american propaganda spouted by leftist radicals down everyones throat w no recourse but to see it every time they open instagram. Trash company. No morals. No discernible values. Good job instagram you took the vast majority of the absolutely worst people from twitter and now use them as political and social activists to shove down everyones throats. Id say do better but you wont. Your intentions are to dismantle and destroy this country.

title: Threads is what twitter use to be thank god
text: Threads is so refreshing, it‚Äôs what Twitter used to be, Thank God. I see lots of positive posts and it‚Äôs so nice not having Elon on there pushing conspiracy theories. That feels refreshing and I hope it stays this way Facebook Facebook started as a great social community and meta-ruined it pushing you into negative conversations. I‚Äôm hoping threads stays away from that and is a more positive environment to communicate in but I won‚Äôt hold my breath. Hopefully they figure a way to keep out the bots and fake accounts.

title: Threads is the driest social media  app I‚Äôve used so far.
text:
1. The timeline: why don‚Äôt I see people I actually follow on my timeline?
2. Yelling in the dark: my followers don‚Äôt see me if I don‚Äôt see them 
3. No followers list: What‚Äôs up with not letting us see who we actually follow, we can see how many followers we have but we don‚Äôt see who or how many we‚Äôre actually following. 
4. No photo editing in app: Why can‚Äôt I do a simple photo crop in the app while posting. Instead I have to delete draft, go out the app, crop pic in my phone, then go back in the app to post‚Ä¶it‚Äôs kinda annoying 
5. It literally feels like I‚Äôm shadow banned: I have 400+ followers and zero interactions.

title: Amazing App!
text: I‚Äôve been using this app for a couple days now, and it is amazing for a Twitter alternative. If there was one thing that Threads could have, is the ability to switch accounts like you can on Instagram. I made threads for all 3 of my accounts, and the way to switch accounts currently is a bit time consuming, and kinda takes away from my experience. Other than that, amazing app, amazing community!

title: Let me create my friends list!
text:
I‚Äôm very annoyed that it limits how many people I can search for. It‚Äôs a new app, I need to search for my people that I have on other platforms. That makes sense to me. And just as others are coming coming onboard I get limited. My favorite just went live and I‚Äôm blocked because of this ambiguous rule and I‚Äôm missing out on posting on their feed. 

But don‚Äôt worry. I‚Äôm getting threads suggested feeds. Which has not been the biggest hit. Again, wouldn‚Äôt be a big deal if I could better curate my list. Right now, I‚Äôm annoyed.

title: Needs hashtags or better discovery
text: Solid app and constantly improving but the biggest thing for me is that we need a better way for others to discover each other. I feel like o get absolutely zero engagement on my posts here and there‚Äôs no clear way to increase that and find an audience because we don‚Äôt have hashtags or another system. It‚Äôs not transparent/clear how posts are shown to users.

title: Thread Badge
text:
Hello, 

I love Thread and as someone who waited a long Time for a new platform so I can build my brand, I‚Äôm really excited about Thread.  The only thing the Developers need to work on is to bring back the  Badge. I unknowingly remove my Bring from my Instagram page now I can‚Äôt bring it back and I really need it because I‚Äôm ready to build a new space for myself. 
Aside that I think it‚Äôs going to be a really great platform.

title: Love this app !!
text:
Whatever anyone says this app is the best thing to come out right now ever since musk took over twitter. Threads is basically like a big group chat and we‚Äôre all like a family
on there. Nobodies being weird or saying out of pocket things everyone is actually nice to each other, unlike the other app. Zuck you really stepped up and made one of the best apps out there. And everyone is already addicted, keep it up!

title: Many Instagram users were hacked & can‚Äôt get threads
text: Hi guys, many of us on Instagram have experienced, shall we call them ‚Äútechnical difficulties‚Äù and have only limited use of our Instagram accounts through Facebook. Many of us are interested in joining Threads, but Simply cannot because our Instagram accounts have been compromised. We get an error message blaming us for the problem, accusing us of sharing our data with 3rd parties. I can assure you that our account did no such thing. At this crucial time in history, when people need to talk to each other, this is no time to mess with peoples accounts. It‚Äôs supposed to be social media.

title: The SM We Need
text: I never jumped aboard the Twitter train. However, Threads takes everything I hate about social media and tosses it out the window. The app makes it easy to identify trolls and block them without any fuss. From day 1 I found my people and my circle just keeps expanding. If this platform takes it easy and doesn‚Äôt start flooding me with ads and recommendations, I don‚Äôt see myself quitting the app any time soon.

title: NOPE
text: Had I known I wouldn‚Äôt be able to DELETE my threads account I wouldn‚Äôt have given it a try. What‚Äôs the point of being able follow people if you‚Äôre not able to see  their posts?  You shouldn‚Äôt have to spend half your time on the app trying to figure out how to find people you‚Äôre following or figure out the app altogether.  The few times I logged in, I quickly became tired of seeing half-naked females and people that have no relation to the people and pages I actually follow. If threads wasn‚Äôt connected to my business account on Instagram I would DELETE it all, instead I‚Äôm stuck with threads being deactivated. It‚Äôs a NO for me.

title: Too much forced spam.
text:
Meta is making quite a bit of progress with Threads. It‚Äôs turning out to be a nice platform that seems to be moderated better than Instagram. Instagram is filled with misogyny, racism and homophobia. I have yet to see anything to the same degree as Instagram and that is very pleasant. If Meta can continue to improve the platform and maintain the healthy environment, then this will certainly be my primary social media. 

Great job so far.

title: Current bug
text:
There‚Äôs currently a bug when composting a post. If you wish to attach an image the search function is unavailable. When you tap the search bar it isn‚Äôt selectable and you end up selecting the text box for the post, which is behind the attachments pane. 

Pretty annoying as I exclusively use the search function built into iOS photos to make posts.

title: (Almost) Worth the switch
text:
Came over from Twitter, where I primarily used my account for semi-professional networking.

The pros:
‚Ä¢ quite a bit of my network has followed because Threads is well put together
‚Ä¢ making account was easy, albeit required I make a new instagram account
‚Ä¢ more or less functions how everyone would expect

The one giant con is that there‚Äôs no following page. I‚Äôm a young person who follows (and enjoys) some of the pop culture pages on my personal account, where I follow them. I don‚Äôt want to see them on my professional account, where I‚Äôm scrolling to see what‚Äôs new in my field. Although less of an issue, the vice versa is also true. 

This feels like an easy fix that should be top of the list - give me the option to just look at the interactions of who I signed up to follow!

title: Very easy to use. Simple.
text:
Personally I appreciate the simplicity. Hopefully the layout doesn‚Äôt change too much in the future.

I haven‚Äôt noticed anything I could mention that needs to be improved. I don‚Äôt have any problems using the app. It would be great to have a feature where you can prefer content not to pop up on your timeline. 

Like on IG, the ‚ÄúNot Interested‚Äù option.

title: Meta continues to foster division to encourage utilization
text:
Signed up for Threads on day 1 of go-live. Admittedly I am not an influencer or really anyone of significance, so I plodded away with it for a couple weeks, didnt get much traction, got bored and forgot about it. Stopped using it for a few months. 

Logged back on, tried to get back into using it regularly around Christmas 2023. Was very disgusted to see that - as with Meta‚Äôs other products - well over 75% of posts being pushed out to me were topics/positions that they somehow knew I‚Äôd oppose or be upset by. Temptation got the better of me and I engaged with them‚Ä¶so I suppose their approach worked. 

But then I said ‚Äúno more,‚Äù and uninstalled the app after I realized that the stress I was enduring from seeing the garbage being suggested to me was not worth it. No amount of ‚Äúdisengaging, blocking and muting‚Äù was changing what I was seeing. 

Threads - and all the apps like it - are going to be the undoing of our society. Keep your hot takes to yourself, noone actually cares.

title: Threads > Twitter
text: Quite simply it keeps all your OG apps together in a sense: Facebook, Snapchat, Instagram, and now Threads (Twitter ran by an actual social media mogul) in Meta. If you want a smooth transition from Instagram to another way of expressing yourself via Threads, this is the app for you. Instagram links to Threads via your profile and vice versa making them simple extensions of each-other rather than being completely indifferent apps. Good Job so far üëåüèæ

title: Data collection more invasive than a colonoscopy
text:
After reading ‚ÄúData Linked to You‚Äù I couldn‚Äôt think of a metric they‚Äôre not collecting. Someone needs to tell Meta that ‚Äú1984‚Äù was a warning and not an instruction manual.

If you loved the abuse Meta foisted of you with Facebook and Instagram through the pushing of the most inflammatory content solely to raise engagement and their emotionally manipulative advertising all the while tracking you like a parolee with a GPS ankle bracelet you‚Äôll love Treads. Otherwise join Mastodon which doesn‚Äôt manipulate your feed, has no advertising and collects zero tracking data on its users.

Threads again shows Meta is an electronic version of cancer.

title: Threadsüòå, etc
text: Hi there i‚Äôm so new to the whole threads app the i have been doing this since the app came out. Ngl i love to use it. Even thou i don‚Äôt really be using it the much. cause i deleted it because i wanna to take a break from the app. But so far it is good to use more then twitter,  i offload twitter cause i wanna take a break from the app as well. this app is safe to use and not toxic like instagram, twitter. Keep the updates coming

title: Super Star App
text: Threads is great. And I know there is more to come. Personally, one of my favorite things about Threads is the total absence of ads as I scroll. If this is the future of social media and Threads, the sky is the limit for this app. Annoying ads really are a buzzkill as you scroll. Threads is amazing without them. Plus the community on Threads right now is such a vibe and so positive. I‚Äôm rooting for Threads to keep growing. It‚Äôs got huge potential. Let‚Äôs go!

title: I love Threads!
text: I came over after Musk decided to make it his life‚Äôs mission to destroy Twitter. I enjoy the people, for one. I haven‚Äôt run into anyone who‚Äôs outright rude, which I cannot say about Twitter. I‚Äôm not someone who goes online to start conflicts either. But it‚Äôs not Twitter. You can‚Äôt expect to completely supplement the experience with a different app. I‚Äôm sure it will grow over time, as apps do. I think it‚Äôs fairly robust, to star!

title: Was fine for like three hours
text:
Last night I downloaded the app, and my feed was full of my friends and things my friends had commented on, it felt really nice and authentic.

Today, I haven't seen a single post from my friends, instead the feed is entirely people I don't know and don't follow. I refreshed the page and decided to scroll and count how many stranger posts I'd see before I saw my friends posts, I decided to stop counting at 100. 

What's the point in following my friends on here if you're not gonna show me what they're posting? I'll be deleting the app until it's fixed.

title: Fills the Twitterless void
text: I am very happy to now be able to go on something similar to Twitter, because I deleted Twitter after finding Elon musk defending some transphobe and also was sick of getting banned for telling another user or politician to go f themselves. I am happy to announce this app fills the Twitter void if you‚Äôve deleted it, and you wont get banned for anything and everything, unlike Twitter right now. Thank you Zuck, you did right this time.

title: Just stuck
text: I would like to use threads and can be patient about features like followers only feed or what have you, but the app has been broken for me for over a week (since I tried to write a long thread, ironically). I can‚Äôt post, can‚Äôt see notifications or profile pages or replies, and so am kind of stuck. It‚Äôs too bad on the one hand, but a way to wean me off socials on the other.

title: Some Issues MAJOR that need to be addressed sooner rather then later.
text:
It‚Äôs a good app however it needs a lot of work and features that all other social networks have.

1. Chronological home feed so you can view thing in order.

2. For you feed so you ca see only the Threads from people you follow also in chronological order.

3. The ability to view the list of people you follow and ability to unfollow from the list.

4. The ability to view things you liked and favorited as a feed in your profile page.

These are major things that all other social networks have and Threads doesn‚Äôt have and for a lot of people that‚Äôs a deal breaker. I hope to see these features sooner rather then later because people WILL stop using this app and go back the the app Elon is currently hellbent on killing because there will be no better place.
